content:
Apologies for the confusion. I've revised the return trip to ensure you take the Eurotunnel on April 16th. I've also combined some of the legs on the return trip to make this possible, which may result in longer driving hours on certain days.

Outbound Trip (Days 1-9): Same as previously suggested (London to Nice, including Lake Como).

Days 10-11 (April 12-13): Explore Nice and the surrounding area

Day 12 (April 14): Nice to Lyon, France

* Distance: 292 miles / 470 km
* Driving time: 4.5 hours

Day 13 (April 15): Lyon to Reims, France

* Distance: 314 miles / 505 km
* Driving time: 5 hours

Day 14 (April 16): Reims to Calais (Eurotunnel), then Calais to London

* Distance: 165 miles / 266 km (Reims to Calais)
* Driving time: 2.5 hours (Reims to Calais)
* Distance: 108 miles / 174 km (Calais to London, excluding Eurotunnel crossing time)
* Driving time: 2 hours (Calais to London, excluding Eurotunnel crossing time)

Total distance for the entire journey (outbound and return trips): 2,194 miles / 3,530 km

By combining the exploration of Reims with the journey to Calais on April 16th, you can take the Eurotunnel on the desired date. Please note that driving times and distances are approximate and may vary depending on traffic and road conditions. Enjoy your road trip!
